thread.title: Manchester derby on February 26 to be rescheduled after United reach EFL Cup final
thread.title_full: Manchester derby on February 26 to be rescheduled after United reach EFL Cup final

author: Liam Corless
title: Manchester derby on February 26 to be rescheduled after United reach EFL Cup final
text:
Manchester derby on February 26 to be rescheduled after United reach EFL Cup final The match could take place in late April if last season is anything to go by Share Jose Mourinho and Pep Guardiola will have to rejig their diaries (Photo: Manchester United/Getty Images) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
Manchester United's trip to neighbours City next month will be rescheduled after they reached the EFL Cup final. 
Jose Mourinho's side were due to visit the Etihad on Sunday, February 26, but will instead be at Wembley that day taking on Southampton. 
United secured their passage into the final with a 3-2 aggregate win over Hull in the last four, despite losing the second leg at the KCOM Stadium by two goals to one. 
There is no indication yet as to when the rescheduled Manchester derby will take place, but it is likely to occur in April if last season is anything to go by. Next month's Manchester derby will be rescheduled after United reached the EFL Cup final (Photo: Clive Brunskill) 
Liverpool and Manchester City, last season's League Cup finalists, were initially scheduled to face Everton and Newcastle respectively on the weekend of the final. 
Those two league fixtures were eventually completed almost two months later, with City drawing 1-1 at Newcastle on April 19 and Liverpool beating Everton 4-0 at Anfield the following day. 
United and City have played each other twice this season, with City coming out on top in the Premier League meeting in September and United knocking their rivals out of the EFL Cup at the fourth round stage in October. poll loading Who will finish higher in the table? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
